title: Reflexive relation - Introduction
course: Discrete Mathematics by Prof Sudarshan Iyengar

transcript.text: You see, life is full of different  types of things. You take a vehicle,
there are different types of vehicles,  a two-wheeler, a three-wheeler,
a four-wheeler, right, even an aeroplane for  that matter is a type of vehicle. Similarly,
a relation, as we define, even that comes  in different types. It is important for
us to study them by segregating different  types of relations. First in the sequence
is what we call the Reflexive Relation. Let  me motivate it properly with a nice example.
